abstract.text: A request for the current status of a previously booked ride.
Siri phrases that trigger a request for a ride’s status
A request for the current status of a previously booked ride.
The handler interface for fetching the status of the user’s current ride.
Your app’s response to a get ride status intent.
Initializes the get ride status intent object.
An interface for providing updated status for an active ride.

inlineContent.text: When there is a request for the status of a booked ride, SiriKit sends an
object to your handler object. Upon receiving this intent, fetch the ride status and return it in your response object. The intent object has no additional parameters.
To handle this intent, the handler object in your Intents extension must adopt the
protocol. Your handler should confirm the request and create an
object with the status of the ride.
lists additional attributes of this intent object.
Apps can optionally ask the user to unlock the device before handling this intent. To require unlocking of the device, include the name of this class in the
Users can ask Siri for the status of a ride in a variety of ways.
provides a few sample phrases in different languages. You can use these phrases during testing to trigger your intents. This list isn’t exhaustive and Siri may recognize many other phrases.
How far away is my driver on
喺滴滴出行問吓司機架車幾時到
喺滴滴出行问吓司机架车几时到
hvor er det jeg hentes af
Quanto è lontano il mio autista
のドライバーはどこにいるの
Hoe ver weg is mijn bestuurder van
Quão longe está meu  motorista do
อยู่ไกลแค่ไหน

abstract.text: Siri phrases that trigger a request for a ride’s status

inlineContent.text: represents the name of the app whose Intents extension gets the ride status. If your app uses custom names for ride options, you can tell SiriKit about those names using the global vocabulary file.
